item.description:
In case you want orange on you or your dog it will be hunting season for turkeys and deer (archery) and deer (muzzleloader) during the hike.

Here are 2 links to a trail map:

http://www.nhstateparks.com/Maps/pawhiking.html

http://www.nhstateparks.org/uploads/pdf/PawtuckawayTrailMap_web.pdf

Please note that we are using a rear entrance to the park on Reservation Rd. off of Route 107 (Raymond Road) in Deerfield.  We are not using the front entrance to the Park on Mountain Road off of Route 156 in Nottingham. The 3 pictures show the start of Reservation Rd. The 3rd picture shows a mailbox across the street near Reservation Road (137 Raymond Road, Deerfield, NH).

One AMC trail guide describes the North Mountain Trail as the most scenic in the park. There are several drop offs in places on North Mountain if your dog is not "cliff smart".

Starting off at number 12 on the map we will use the North Mountain Trail to hike along the ridge of North Mountain heading in a northerly direction.  At the south end of North Mountain there is a fairly steep section that is 0.3 miles in distance for an elevation gain of about 300 feet.  Then the traverse along the mountain ridge is much flatter even though there is some uphill and down hill. Having hiked 1.5 miles from the starting point we reach the summit for an elevation gain of 500 feet. Then from the summit we descend 600 ft over 1.2 miles.  At the northern end of North Mountain there are some steep downhill sections of trial lasting 0.4 miles.  Then at 10 we start heading south again each step getting us closer to the cars. On the way back we ascend 300 feet that is spread out over 2.7 miles as we use a small section of the Round Pond Road and North Mtn. Bypass Trail to return to the southern end of North Mtn.  Then at the southern end of North Mountain we  retrace the 0.5 mile route on the North Mtn. Trail down hill back to the starting point descending 100 feet.  Total elevation gain 800 feet.

There is a photo of the hike route in the photo album with a comment on the hikes elevations gains and losses along the route.

You should definitely bring some water along for your dog and some food and drink for yourself.

So everyone is covered by the liability waiver any guest you want to bring should sign up as a member to come on the hike. Minors would need a waiver signed by a parent/guardian.

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Once you turn onto Reservation Road off of Route 107 proceed 1.8 miles at which point Reservation Rd intersects with North Mountain Trail. Reservation Rd at this point is a dirt road. This is number 12 on the map.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: N. Mountain - Pawtuckaway St. Park - 5 mile moderate loop hike
